Freedom of thought and expression, free speech and First Amendment rights are part of our precious inheritance, even if they differ from each other. Let‚Äôs be better stewards of that inheritance. Fin
I don‚Äôt mean to pick just on the Right here. Particularly in places like academia, elements of the Left are pushing ideas and taking actions inimical to the principles of freedom of expression. 4/4

Nor does free speech or the 1st Amendment require a private medium, social or otherwise, to publish your stuff. That‚Äôs THEIR protected choice. Your recourse is to ignore that medium if you choose. Or start another one! 3/4

That‚Äôs not free speech, folks. In fact, the principles of free expression depend on a community (as opposed to an authority) discussing and evaluating what people say. That‚Äôs kind of the whole idea underlying the ‚Äúmarketplace of ideas‚Äù. 2/4
I‚Äôm coming to understand that many people (particularly on the Right) think that free speech means ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt ever get held accountable for what I say anywhere by anyone.‚Äù 1/4

‚ÄúI believe that unarmed truth and unconditional love will have the final word in reality. This is why right, temporarily defeated, is stronger than evil triumphant.‚Äù
